text: Julissa Reynoso Pantaleón (born January 2, 1975) is a Dominican-American lawyer and politician. She was the United States Ambassador to Spain from 2022 to 2024. She was the chief of staff to First Lady Jill Biden from 2021 until 2022. From March 2012 until December 2014, she was United States ambassador to Uruguay from 2012 until 2014. She is a former deputy assistant secretary for the Bureau of Western Hemisphere Affairs at the United States Department of State. President Biden nominated her to be the next United States Ambassador to Spain on July 27, 2021, being confirmed on December 18, 2021. She resigned in July 2024 and rejoined her previous law firm Winston & Strawn. ==References== Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Spain Category:Lawyers from New York (state) Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Dominican Republic lawyers Category:Dominican Republic politicians
title: Julissa Reynoso Pantaleón
